titleInfo.title: Caspar Mansker memorial grave marker, Peay Park, Goodlettsville, Tennessee, n.d.

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: Pictured: The memorial grave marker of Casper Mansker, located in Goodlettsville’s Peay Park, circa June 1981. Mansker was originally buried at the site of his station, but in 1956 his remains were disinterred and moved to new site. Casper (Kasper) Mansker was a prominent Cumberland frontiersman, a longhunter, pioneer, Indian fighter, soldier and one of middle Tennessee’s first European explorers and settlers. He was a signer of the Cumberland Compact in 1780, which established the first government in the Cumberland Valley. Forms part of the Bill Goodman Photographic Slides Collection. 1 35 mm negative.
